website_summaries.verdict: A more advanced lawn mower option in Troy-Bilt's lineup, making for a perfect upgrade.
pros: Features a 163cc Briggs and Stratton engine with a quick-start mechanism to get up and running quickly
Can release trimmings from the side or into a bag for greater flexibility
Easily raise and lower cutting height with the adjuster
cons: Handle controls for speed are not comfortable for long periods of use

customer_reviews.title: After 59 years I finally get a great mower
customer_reviews.text: I've been mowing grass for 59 years (!) and this is easily my favorite mower. Great "out of box experience." [Swing the handle up, connect it, put the grass catcher bag on the frame, hook it in, pour in the oil (included) put in some gasoline and start it. Total time: 15 min, 11 of which was to decipher the diagrams in the booklet.] I bought it because I had a front wheel drive lawn mower that was heavier and the self-propeller just way too much work for me at my age. But this mower: you really do just lean the top bar forward and start walking. No pushing at all. Everything adjusted properly from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!!
customer_reviews.text: Got it Monday. Assembled it Tuesday. Used it on Saturday long enough to fill 2 trimming bags, then it blew oil right through the air filter. Ran for a total of 2 hours before it went. Removed filter, cleaned up the excess oil, it did start back up without the filter. I have to go get a new filter so I can finish my lawn. I was about half done.
customer_reviews.author: Kronman

customer_reviews.title: The manual that comes with it could definitively be presented better. Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: A bit confusing to get used to as all lever positions seemed to be the exact opposite of the mower I was replacing. The manual that comes with it could definitively be presented better. Cuts great, and the wash out feature is excellent. Also, the one lever height adjustment is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie S

customer_reviews.title: Troy-Bilt hits a Home Run.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mower. It does the yard like a hot knife going thru butter. The only complaint are the miserable instructions that accompany the unit. Confusing would be an understatement. It took me about 30 minutes to figure out how to set up the unit. It should take about 10 minutes. Once I got it running, it's a gem of a machine. I would recommend using Mobil 1 5W-30 if you live in the Northeast or an area where temperatures vary significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Honig

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LAWN MOWER  Troy-Bilt is the best !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great lawn mower, purchased to replace another name brand mower. B&S engine performs perfectly (better than the Honda) could not be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bbbbadwizard

customer_reviews.title: Works as  expected
customer_reviews.text: Like the one adjustment lever. One pull start, no problems. In step works very nice. Water hose hook up to wash under side is also a good feature. All in all no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Yep

customer_reviews.title: the handle for the self propelled action to occur is ...
customer_reviews.text: the handle for the self propelled action to occur is awful. Its not ergonomic and the rate of speed is very hard to control.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Govette

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've had for about 2 months now and everything is as expected
customer_reviews.author: VINCENT BAMRICK

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: still trying how to understand how the self propel works
customer_reviews.author: Crispin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in perfect condition. Had a ding/tear in the carton, but the mower was unmarked! Assembly was a piece of cake. Mower handles great, especially for an old man like myself, with a bad back!! Am able to control this with one hand, easy to back up, relatively easy to turn from a stopped position, cuts grass and picks it up very cleanly. One pull to start! My other mower(s) required multiple pulls and various "Navel quotes" before they would start!!! Very please with this mower and would recommend it without hesitation!!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Van Dine

customer_reviews.title: This lawn mower is garbage! I received it on May 23
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower is garbage! I received it on May 23, it was great started on second pull the first time out of the box. Them I didn't use it for 3 weeks, and now it won't start at all. I pulled the cord about 25 times and nothing. Feels like I threw my money out the window. I would not recommend this product to anyone, im just upset cuz I bought it
customer_reviews.author: George Stanley

customer_reviews.title: This one is the "BOSS" of all push mowers.
customer_reviews.text: After having to push and fight with my old mower, this one seems like a Cadillac. Nice cut and lot faster getting the job done. Self propelled is the way to go for an old woman as myself.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my dad. He hasn't used it yet, but we have had the same mower for three years and it is easy to use and cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the TB360 2 years ago and it has been downhill ever since. First, the forward throttle to go forward was very hard getting used to and I still curse it. The bolt that holds the side discharge flap came apart within the fist year and have been wiring and duct taping ever since. The seal for the grass catcher never did work completely. Without a proper seal, grass blows in your face and all over the mower. Hope they have resolved these issues. Now, the mower won't start no many how many pulls. You would hope a mower would last at least 3 years without major hassles - and it's more than just the spark plug.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kloes

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap cheap!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought from Troybilt direct Self propelled wheels in back broken on delivery..one spins one is stuck and will not even roll. Cheap cheap cheap!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Beauchamp

product_meta.title: Troy-Bilt TB370 163cc 21-inch In Step RWD Self-Propelled Lawn Mower
product_meta.description: Clean up your yard this season easily with the Troy-Bilt TB370 163cc 21-Inch In-Step RWD Self-Propelled Lawn mower. The TB370 rear wheel drive self-propelled lawn mower features the all new In Step variable speed drive system. In Step naturally adjusts to your speed, providing precise speed control and delivers more traction over rough terrain. Easily raise and lower cutting height with the single-lever height adjuster. Equipped with a 163cc Briggs & Stratton engine, the Tri-Action Cutting System and the capability to side discharge, mulch or bag, this lawn mower gives you added versatility to handle any yard. Equipped with a ReadyStart Choke System with no priming required. Plus, a cutting range with six settings ranging from 1.25-3.75-inches. This mower has 8-inch front and 11-inch durable rear wheels. Troy-Bilt offers a 2-year limited warranty on the TB370.
feature_bullets: Powered by a 163cc Briggs & Stratton engine with ReadyStart choke system for an easy start
Equipped with a 21-inch Tri-Action cutting system to give you a clean cut in one pass. Adjust the cutting height up to 6 different settings ranging from 1.25-3.75 inches.
Designed with a 3-in-1 capability to side discharge, mulch or rear bag. Remove blade from the adapter for testing balance.
Easily raise and lower cutting height with the single-lever height adjuster.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars33 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
